note.p: Paris, Bibliothèque nationale de France, fr. 380
Roman de la Rose (ff. 1r-139r), Le Testament (ff. 140r-153r), Les Sept articles de la foi (ff. 154r-159v), Le Codicille (ff. 159v-160r)
Bâtarde, written in 2 columns of 41 lines, 1 scribe
1 artist (possibly the artist of ms. fr. 12595?)

50 single-column panel miniatures in colors and gold, within gold frames with trifoliate leaf extenders (ff. 1r, 1v, 2r (x2), 2v (x2), 3r, 3v, 4r (x2), 5r, 6v, 10v, 12r, 13v, 14r, 14v, 19v, 20v, 21r, 22r, 23r, 24r, 25v, 26v, 28v, 29v, 36v, 38v, 43v, 44r, 46v, 49r, 57r, 62v, 67v, 69r, 70r, 73r, 81r, 84r, 85v, 99v, 108r, 125r, 132v, 135v, 140r, 154r, 159v); 1-sided foliate bar borders and decorated initials in colors and gold on ff. 1r, 140r, 154r, 159v; the miniature on f. 140 is for Le Testament, the one on f. 154r is for Les Sept articles de la foi, and the final miniature, on f. 159v, is for Le Codicille. Blue initials flourished in red, gold initials flourished in blue.
374 x 280 mm (this measurement is from Langlois)

French, 17th century; red morocco with gilt fillet border and arms of Colbert (snake surrounded by the collars of the Orders of St Michael and of the Holy Ghost) stamped in centre of upper and lower covers, raised spine bands, marbled endpapers.

Jean de Berry (1340-1416), beginning of 15th century (on frontmatter.flyleaf.03r is written "Le Romant de la Rose. Est a Jehan, filz de roy de France, duc de Berry et d'Auvergne, conte de Poitou, d'Estampes, de Bouloingne et d'Auvergne. Flamel," and on f. 160r "Ce livre est au duc de Berry. Jehan"); Jean-Baptiste Colbert (1619-1683), 2nd half of 17th century (stamped in gold on upper and lower covers) - it was ms. 2623 in his collection; 18th century stamp of Bibliotheca Regiae (royal library), where it was ms. 6985 (ff. 1r, 160v)
1. Paulin Paris, Les manuscrits françois de la Bibliothèque du roi (Paris: Techener, 1836-1848), III, pp. 174-176
